Text saved: If we understand more about the possible differences in what people expect and how they behave, this can help us avoid communication problems. However, it is also very important to remember that cultural **stereotypes**, which are simple but often untrue ideas about a group of people, can be bad for building good business relationships.

Although national culture can influence the way we behave and think, we are also influenced by many other things. These include the region we come from, the communities we are part of, our age and gender, our company's culture, and our own personal experiences. Therefore, our knowledge of these possible differences should be something we remember, but we should not use it to label all the people from an entire nation in the same way.
